subject: Music
title: Musical Illusions
description: A quick, practical guide to Musical Illusions.

hook.text: Your brain fills in missing notes, invents melodies from noise, and hears music that isn't there.

buildup.text: The continuity illusion makes you hear a tone as continuous even when it's briefly interrupted.

discovery.text: Diana Deutsch discovered that simple tones played in patterns create phantom melodies.

twist.text: Musical hallucinations are common in elderly people â€” the brain generates music from silence.

climax.text: Music perception is partly creative â€” your brain constructs what it expects to hear.

punchline.text: Half the music you hear is real. The other half, your brain invents.

quiz.question: What are musical hallucinations?
options: The brain generating music that isn't actually playing, common in the elderly
